availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Bernard M. Kington (Hopkins County, Ky, farmer.)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Sullivan County, Tennessee, native. Married to Sarah Kington. Father of George W. Kington, Malvina Kington, Mary C. Kington, and Joseph B. Kington. Married to Nancy Medlock Kington in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on June 5, 1856. Father of Bernard M. Kington. Stepfather of Eliza J. Medlock, John A. Medlock, I. J. Medlock, and William A. Medlock. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 164A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 734.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 215B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hopkins County Marriages.
